conclusion: Consider the forces acting on each segment of the wire (AB and BC) due to the magnetic fields.
The wire AB is in a magnetic field pointing inward, and the wire BC is in a magnetic field pointing outward.
The force on AB, F_AB, is given by F_AB = I * L * B, and it points downward.
The force on BC, F_BC, is given by F_BC = I * L * B, and it points upward.
Resolve F_AB and F_BC into components along the direction of the wire and perpendicular to it.
The vertical components of F_AB and F_BC cancel each other out, and the horizontal components add up.
The horizontal component of each force is F_horizontal = I * L * B * 1/2.
The total horizontal force is F_total = I * L * B.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the wire is I * L * B.
